words.source: H7592 (שׁאל), HC/Vqq3fs (conjunctive/Qal-perfect-3fs, sequential future). DIVERGENT: KJV 'shall borrow' (misleading per modern scholarship), ESV 'shall ask', NASB 'will ask'. The verb שׁאל means 'ask/request', not 'borrow'.
H802 (אִשָּׁה), HNcfsa (noun-common-fs-absolute). KJV 'every woman', ESV 'every woman', NASB 'every woman'.
H7934 (שָׁכֵן), HR/Aafsc/Sp3fs (preposition-min/adjective-fs-construct/suffix-3fs). KJV 'of her neighbour', ESV 'of her neighbor', NASB 'from her neighbor'.

words.phrase: and from the woman living in her house
words.source: H1481 (גור), HC/R/Vqrfsc (conjunctive/preposition-min/Qal-participle-fs-construct). KJV 'and of her that sojourneth in her house', ESV 'and from the woman who lives in her house', NASB 'and from the woman who lives in her house'.
H1004 (בַּיִת), HNcmsc/Sp3fs (noun-common-ms-construct/suffix-3fs). KJV 'her house', ESV 'her house', NASB 'her house'.
H3627 (כְּלִי), HNcmpc (noun-common-mp-construct). KJV 'jewels of', ESV 'jewelry of', NASB 'articles of'.
H3701 (כֶּסֶף), HNcmsa (noun-common-ms-absolute). KJV 'silver', ESV 'silver', NASB 'silver'. All agree.
H3627 (כְּלִי), HC/Ncmpc (conjunctive/noun-common-mp-construct). KJV 'and jewels of', ESV 'and jewelry of', NASB 'and articles of'.
H2091 (זָהָב), HNcmsa (noun-common-ms-absolute). KJV 'gold', ESV 'gold', NASB 'gold'. All agree.
H8071 (שִׂמְלָה), HC/Ncfpa (conjunctive/noun-common-fp-absolute). KJV 'and raiment', ESV 'and clothing', NASB 'and clothing'.
H7760 (שׂים), HC/Vqq2mp (conjunctive/Qal-perfect-2mp, sequential future). KJV 'and ye shall put them', ESV 'You shall put them', NASB 'and you will put them'.
H1121 (בֵּן), HNcmpc/Sp2mp (noun-common-mp-construct/suffix-2mp). KJV 'your sons', ESV 'your sons', NASB 'your sons'.
H5921 (עַל), HC/R (conjunctive/preposition). KJV 'and upon', ESV 'and on', NASB 'and on'.
H1323 (בַּת), HNcfpc/Sp2mp (noun-common-fp-construct/suffix-2mp). KJV 'your daughters', ESV 'your daughters', NASB 'your daughters'.

H5337 (נצל), HC/Vpq2mp (conjunctive/Piel-perfect-2mp, sequential future). DIVERGENT: KJV 'ye shall spoil', ESV 'you shall plunder', NASB 'you will plunder'. The Piel of נצל means 'to strip, plunder' — a reversal of the Israelites' exploitation.
H853 (אֵת), HTo (direct object marker). Untranslated in English.
H4713 (מִצְרַיִם), HNp (proper noun). KJV 'the Egyptians', ESV 'the Egyptians', NASB 'the Egyptians'. Used here for the people of Egypt.
